bug.description:
With version 4, plotly has moved all online features to a new chart-studio package. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
What are the steps we should take to reproduce the bug:
Import plotly.express as px
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
Plotly should be imported for use with st.plotly_chart() <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
Plotly is unable to be imported. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6628275/64979382-773c0300-d86c-11e9-92b4-39fd81b7fb01.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
Functions as expected with plotly 3.10. <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.45.0 Python version: 3.7.4 Using Conda OS version: Ubuntu 19.04 Browser version: Chrome 77.0.3865.75
<denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
Not the end of the world as 3.10 is still working; was curious if there is a way to include the necessary version of plotly as a dependency somewhere.

comments.comment:
Hi j4th, I'm having trouble reproducing the issue, could you provide more detailed reproduction steps? A larger snippet that results in the error being thrown, or your entire app would be ideal. With that said, Plotly v4 changed its main package and is accessed differently than in v3. With v4 import chart_studio.plotly as ply With v3 import plotly.plotly as ply Please verify the version you're using and access the Plotly object accordingly. Streamlit apps should work with both versions. Check version <denchmark-code>import plotly plotly.__version__ </denchmark-code>
To install v4 <denchmark-code>pip install chart-studio pip install plotly==4 </denchmark-code>
To install v3 <denchmark-code>pip install plotly==3 </denchmark-code>
Also, looks like you're on version 0.45.0 of Streamlit, feel free to update to 0.46.0 with pip install --upgrade streamlit if there's no blockers on your end. Let us know if you're still having issues afterwards. Thanks!
